fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let I\times J\xrightarrow {F} C be a bifunctorial diagram such that the following limits and colimits exist. Then there is a canonical map \operatorname *{colim}_I \operatorname *{lim}_J F\to \operatorname *{lim}_J \operatorname *{colim}_I F.
In particular, the map goes from a colimit to a limit because colimits are easy to map out of, while limits are easy to map into.
